issue.title: www.reddit.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.reddit.com/r/popular/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.reddit.com%2Fr%2Fpopular%2F) ### Comment > Using Samsung Internet along with the Adguard content blocker I've noticed that the bothersome reddit "open in app" popups keep appearing. Tried using user rules similar to those found here: > https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MrBukLau/filter-lists/master/filters/mobilefilters.txt > but could not get the site to work properly, at most the popups dissapear but also does the scroll function, making the site unusable. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/xXL368q.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard Content Blocker v2.6.1 Browser: | Samsung Browser Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

Social Widgets:
AdGuard Social Media

Annoyances:
AdGuard Annoyances

Language-specific:
AdGuard Spanish/Portuguese

comment.body:
There's more to consider.

When I load or reload Reddit pages the usual way I see the blank icons and media placeholders, and the Adguard blocked ads counter shows 0. However, when I reload the page from the filtering log pane, the page displays the correct layout with all the media loaded and the Adguard blocked ads counter is more than 0.

I post screenshots related to every group of filters applied in the _latter_ case.

The screenshot of a correctly displayed Reddit page.

![reddit-subreddits-general](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45983734/202825833-6eac8edd-c5d7-4d9b-942b-f1d2512d6bb3.png)


- **Regular filters**  

![Screen Shot 2022-11-19 at 02 22 38](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45983734/202825649-98f89b08-ebda-4057-8d9d-9c7e2555ebe8.png)
